DOC.brief_summary: The aim study investigate different novel IC technology promote physical activity health prevent obesity young men . The purpose provide new evidence-based knowledge effectiveness ICT-based physical activation identify factor predict positive response . Specific objectives - identify factor associate physical activity physical activity relationship young men - develop interactive method , base peer network , aim activate young men use skill , participation modern ICT - ass effectiveness choose activation physical activity , weight , fitness , health , relationship towards physical activity among young men The study population consist conscription age men Oulu area 2011-2013 ( n=4000 ) . Conscription-aged men provide large , population base representative sample young men . In Finland military service mandatory annually 18-year old men call military service . In call-ups fitness service determine base medical examination . All determined fit service grant postponement due obesity invite activation intervention study . Those severe obesity exempt service , also participate trial . After call-up , men randomise intervention group control group . The primary outcome variable change physical activity . The study conduct 2011-2015 . The study include technology development ( ICT platform ) , collection cross-sectional data call-ups , 6-month physical activity intervention ( randomize control trial ) implement call-up start military service . Game mechanic integrate ICT platform increase user engagement participation . Physical activity , fitness ( aerobic muscular ) , body composition , lifestyle psychological physical health follow . In addition , subject ' entry military service course follow .
